criterion: Reward for accurately documenting the patient’s current semaglutide dose and schedule (0.25 mg drawn up every Sunday morning) as explicitly confirmed by the clinician.
Reward for capturing the storage and pen-replacement instructions for semaglutide (keep in fridge door, not freezer; start a new pen after four doses).
Reward for including the anti-nausea guidance given (sip ginger tea and eat small dry crackers before injecting instead of skipping a dose).
Reward for documenting the plan to stop semaglutide immediately once a home pregnancy test is positive, reflecting the patient’s desire to conceive.
Reward for faithfully recording the insurance denial, clinician’s urgent appeal with ~10-day turnaround, and reassurance that the starter pen will prevent missed doses this month.
Reward for capturing the patient-reported glucose readings (168 before meal, no after-lunch reading, 212 at bedtime) and the bedtime insulin dose of 40 units.
Reward for noting the patient’s reported symptoms (stomach heaviness/queasiness, decreased appetite, minimal weight change) and concerns about pharmacy delays and financial strain.
Reward for documenting the clinician’s request for a detailed walk-through of yesterday’s glucose readings to guide insulin adjustment.

Reward for overall completeness—i.e., the note faithfully reflects all major statements, instructions, and concerns from the transcript while appropriately referencing relevant diabetes history from the chart.
Penalize for introducing fabricated or unsubstantiated content (e.g., additional medication changes, lab orders, lifestyle advice, or assessments) not supported by the transcript or chart.
Penalize for copying irrelevant or excessive chart information (e.g., full medication lists or historical data not referenced in the encounter) that was neither mentioned nor implicitly pertinent.
